instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Had mild water damage. Replaced U9701 twice and U9000

U9000 pin 2 and 3  3.3V pin 1 0V

r9731V 0V

what to check next?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Diode mode in backlight output?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Ppvout_sw_lcdbklt 0.571

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Seems high like an issue around the switch trace of LP8550. Definitely no short on backlight? Fuse ok?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Any voltage at pins 2, 3, 4 of J9000?
You don't get image, why looking for backlight???

Check if board has USB activity.
Do you hear chime at least?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Oh wait my bad I thought he said 3.3 at the connector not U9000. Yes check for USB activity/chime first

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
No chime or usb activity but have 1.1V vcore.

Bios issue?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: J9000 0v pins 2 and 3 but 3.3V on pin 4

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: No chime and USB activity points to a whole different issue. Could be a BIOS issue in this case. Try a new one for testing  and keep the old one in case it is the actual issue.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Also try one DDR3 module at a time, each slot by separate.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
tried new bios and one DDR3 module at a time with no change.

SMC issue?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Does it start in SMC bypass?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Where was the liquid spill?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
SMC bypass mode made no difference, just fast fan spin but still nothing on the screen.

liquid spill was only in lcd area

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
When board properly boots, you should note a drop from 1.1V to aprox 0.8V for CPU VCORE.
LVDS lines go from J9000 to PCH, which could got affected by liquid spill...

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Checked and CPU VCORE is at a steady 1.1V and does not drop.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Try to reball SMC.
If no result change it.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
reballed SMC and no result.

Also changed SMC and still no result. After a few seconds i get one blink from white led every few seconds. Makes no difference if ram is inserted or not.

VCORE still steady 1.1V

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
I suppose bad PCH, or CPU.
Can also be something affected by liquid.
Reflow them with good flux.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
replaced r7402 and now have chime but still no backlight.

J9000 3.2v pins 2, 3, 4.

Already replaced u9701

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Do you have image?
Post D9701 voltage (both pins) and Q9706.
Check F9700 and R0910.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Q9706 pin 4 IS 12.60 V and the rest are 0V

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Change Q9706.
Check first if no short to ground at pin 1.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
no short on pin 1

changed. pin 1 12.60V pin 2  0V pin 3  0V pin 4  0v  pin5 0v  pin 6 12.25V

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
You are confused somehow.
Pins 1, 2, 5, 6 are common for Q9706...
Please be sure about provided information.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: Yes sure about current provided information

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
"pin 1 12.60V pin 2 0V"
IMPOSSIBLE!!!
Pins 1 and 2 are common, as 5 and 6 too; all these (four) pins are directly connected inside the Q9706 package...
Please, look at the schematic.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
mixed up measurements

pin 1 and 2 0v pin 5 and 6 0v pin 4 12.60V

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Pin 3???
That controls the MOSFET...

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: pin 3 12.22V

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
"Do you have image?"
???

Post LCD_BKLT_EN, and voltage pins 2/3, 4, 6, 7 of J9000.
Measure always with LCD connected...

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
pins 2/3, 4, 6, 7  3.2v

LCD_BKLT_EN 0V

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: do not see image on the screen with flashlight. bad pch?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Try another screen.
Be sure no corrosion and good contacts at J9000.
L9080 OK?
Also test external video.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Is board un repairable then? Is it worth trying a new pch?

Vcore does start at 1.1V and then drop to 0.8

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: L9080 looks good but not getting any voltage

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: test screen is a known good screen

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
"Be sure no corrosion and good contacts at J9000.
--------------
Also test external video."

"pins 2/3... 3.2v"
Looks like screen is detected; you should also get image.

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: what about backlight?

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message: replaced j9000. now have backlight but a gray/dark screen. Using a good tested screen

threads.title: 820-2936 no backlight
threads.message:
Start using USB OSX.
Also try to acces boot menu.
Voltage pins 21/22 of J9000?

"Also test external video."
Please do the required tests when asked; do NOT wait third time mention...
